Authors:
Bandarupalli devadatha, Veluri Venkateswara Sarma, Abhishek
Baghela, Dhanushka Nadeeshan Wanasinghe
Title:
Vittalia mangrovei gen. et sp. nov. (Phaeosphaeriaceae) from
mangroves near Pondicherry (India), based on morphology and multigene
phylogeny
Keywords:
Mangroves / Marine fungi / Morphology / Phylogeny /
Pleosporales / Taxonomy
Abstract:
Collection and examination of decaying wood samples of
Avicennia marina from Pondicherry mangroves, India resulted in the
discovery of a novel monotypic genus Vittalia, based on the type species
V. mangrovei, which shares closer morphological affinities with Italica
and Phaeosphaeriopsis. The concatenated LSU, SSU, TEF1α and ITS
multigene phylogenetic analyses revealed that Vittalia clustered
together with Italica as a sister clade but forms a separate branch. In
addition, morphological variations in Vittalia mangrovei such as
semi-immersed, globose to sub-globose ascomata, 56 distoseptate,
phragmosporous and yellow to golden-yellow ascospores with high
constriction at the 4th septum, lacking mucilaginous sheath or any
ornamentation clearly delineate the new taxon from the other genera in
Phaeosphaeriaceae. Furthermore, Vittalia is saprobic and occurs
exclusively in marine environment. Morphological characteristics and
phylogenetic relation of Vittalia are discussed by comparing with
closely related genera in Phaeosphaeriaceae in this paper.
